An implementation of com.versant.connector.jvi.cci.VConnection interface representing the application level connection handle.

session - of type FundSession.
localRes - of type LocalResource.
supportsLocalTx - of type boolean which determines whether cci local tx is supported or not. supportsLocalTx will be false in case of adapter with no tx and xa tx support.
Method Detail

close

public void close()
           throws javax.resource.ResourceException
Initiates close of the connection handle at the application level. A client should not use a closed connection to interact with an EIS.

The same connection is returned in cases of connection sharing for the same ManagedConnection. Closing a connection invalidates the connection and throws an exception if trying to close an already closed connection or using other connection operations.

Exception gets thrown in the following scenarios -

Example 1) Closing an already closed connection.

    { Connection con = getConnection (); con.close (); con.close (); }
Example 2) Invoking a method on a closed connection.
    { Connection con = getConnection (); con.close (); TransSession sess = con.getTransSession (); }

However, exception is not thrown in such cases where the number of getConnection calls equal the number of close calls. For e.g all the following cases of connection sharing are valid. NOTE: Connection sharing is provided only in case of Container-Managed tx.

Example 1) EJB A calls getConnection and close twice.

    { Connection con = getConnection (); con.close (); // same connection is returned in case of Container-Managed // Tx only. Connection con1 = getConnection (); con.close (); }
Example 2) EJB A calls getConnection and calls EJB B which again calls getConnection and both close the connection. EJB A m1 ()
    { Connection conn = getConnection (); m2 (); conn.close (); } EJB B m2 () { // same connection is provided by the application server // in case of container-managed tx. Connection conn = getConnection (); conn.close (); }

Specified by:
close in interface javax.resource.cci.Connection
Throws:
javax.resource.ResourceException - if close is called on a connection handle that is already closed or if close on a connection handle fails.

getLocalTransaction

public javax.resource.cci.LocalTransaction getLocalTransaction()
                                                        throws javax.resource.ResourceException
Returns the LocalTransaction instance that enables a component to demarcate resource manager local transactions on the Connection. If a resource adapter does not allow a component to demarcate local transactions on an Connection using LocalTransaction interface, then the method getLocalTransaction should throw a NotSupportedException.

Specified by:
getLocalTransaction in interface javax.resource.cci.Connection
Overrides:
getLocalTransaction in class AbstractVConnection
Returns:
LocalTransaction instance.
Throws:
javax.resource.ResourceException - if failed to return a LocalTransaction instance because of a resource adapter error
javax.resource.NotSupportedException - if the local transaction demarcation is not supported on this Connection.

invalidate

public void invalidate()
Invalidates the connection handle. Invocation of any method on an invalidated connection handle results in an exception.

associateConnection

public void associateConnection(javax.resource.spi.ManagedConnection newMC)
                         throws javax.resource.ResourceException
Dissociates the application level connection handle with the previously associated ManagedConenction instance and associates a new ManagedConnection instance with the connection handle.

Throws:
javax.resource.ResourceException - if unable to associate the new ManagedConnection instance with the connection handle.

checkIfClosed

public void checkIfClosed()
                   throws javax.resource.ResourceException
Checks whether the connection has been closed. Example
    m1 () { getConnection (); close (); getTransSession ();}
The above scenario should throw this exception

Throws:
javax.resource.ResourceException - if the connection handle has been closed
